name: YogaEasy Mobile
task: Concept and design of a holistic and cross-device user experience around online yoga for native Mobile-Apps.
solution: Complete rebrush of the existing App. In addition new features were designed in Figma after extensive UX testing and competitor analysis. Finally, we have also implemented internationalization with regional content.

name: YogaEasy Web
task: Rebrush of the existing Web-Application including new features designed in Figma. The goal was to develop a consistent, cross-device design.
solution: Responsive Redesign of the Web-Application using the newly created Design-System.

name: YogaEasy TV
task: Concept and design of a TV App to provide Yogeasy content on Amazon Prime.
solution: A design system was created in Figma and initial components for the TV app were added. Finally the designs was created in Figma and handed over to the development team.

name: Car Tracker
task: Concept of an mobile App in Figma for controlling a vehicle alarm system based on Material Design.
solution: The main use case is currently focused on retrieving the vehicle position and activating/deactivating the alarm system.

name: Timesheets
task: Concept of a multi-tenant time-tracking App in Figma with recording and export functionality based on Material Design.
solution: The designed user journeys were implemented as an interactive Prototype.

name: Meine Kita
task: Concept of an mobile App that enables educators and parents of a Kindergarden to communicate more easily.
solution: Intractive Prototypes of the first user journeys were designed in Figma.

name: Nivea
task: The user should playfully explore the advent calendar doors on the Nivea website with the daily surprises. Creation of wireframes for the different user flows.
solution: The doors were realized as an advent chain. When the user clicks on a door, the surprise is displayed in an overlay. There you can participate in a raffle or a discount promotion. Wireframes in Sketch and presentation via Invision.

name: Tchibo
task: The coffee module of the Tchibo shop should be improved and designed to be more understandable. The different price constellations should be presented better.
solution: After a requirements workshop, several scribbles were created on paper, which were handed over to UI-Designers and Developers for implementation.

name: DB Systel
task: Concept of a Tablet App that locates freight wagons and records their contents. The user experience must be understood by factory workers.
solution: After the kickoff, the first wireframes were created in Sketch & Invision. Several feedback loops followed and the content was further expanded in agile processes. The design is based on Deutsche Bahn's style guide.

name: DocIdent
task: Concept of a website for digitally signing and storing documents in the blockchain.
solution: Use cases and processes were defined in requirement workshops with the customer. Initially user journeys were created on a whiteboard and later designed in Sketch & Invision.

name: smoothr
task: Concept & design of a point-of-sale Tablet App for restaurant orders.
solution: All functionalities were collected in requirement workshops and formalized as user journeys. Finally the designs were created in Photoshop.

name: Bornholdt Lee
task: Relaunch of the corporate website of the "Bornholdt Lee GmbH". The focus should be on highlighting the references, and making the companies services more clear for potential customers.
solution: Wireframes were created with Axure. The final design was created in Sketch & Invision and continuously refined with the project manager in an agile process. Additionally, a prototype was programmed in HTML & CSS.

name: Duchenne
task: Redesign of the existing website about "Muscular Dystrophy".
solution: After creating the wireframes in Axure, the final designs was built in Photoshop.

name: iChallenge - ING DiBa
task: The iChallenge Tablet App for digital geo caching should be redesigned in ING DiBa's corporate design for a team event.
solution: In Photoshop, the existing iChallenge design was adapted to match ING DiBa's corporate design.

name: Pulvermühle
task: The company "Pulvermühle" wants the orders and payments handled in a Tablet App.
solution: Following a requirements workshop, the wishes and ideas were collected and defined in user journeys. Wireframes were created in Axure, the design was created in Photoshop.

name: Freixenet
task: Freixenet would like to offer a Wine-Guide App that presents different wines in combination with matching recipes.
solution: First we started creating user stories as scribbles, wireframes were created as a prototype and finally the design was done in Photoshop.

name: Bornholdt Lee
task: First relaunch of the "Bornholdt Lee GmbH" company website. The design should modern and appealing.
solution: The concept and the responsive design for various devices were created in Photoshop. Finally the designs were implemented in HTML and CSS.

name: O<sub>2</sub>
task: "Aus Alice wird O<sub>2</sub>" Rebranding of the Alice website with the new O<sub>2</sub> look.
solution: Customization of Coremedia templates with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

name: Tchibo
task: Creation of the weekly product newsletters for Tchibo.
solution: Implementation of the "Wochenwelten" newsletter templates with HTML and CSS.

name: Portfolio
task: My first own website.
solution: The initial scribbles were turned into a design in Photoshop. Finally i implemented the design with HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
